application

Class Screen

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.Screen
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GameScreen, HowToPlayScreen, LeaderboardsScreen, LevelScreen, NewUserScreen, OptionsScreen, TitleScreen

    public abstract class Screen
extends java.lang.Object
    Screen is the abstract superclass of all screens in the game. It contains window dimension constants, and methods required for the transition between screens.
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Gideon Davies.

    • Field Summary

      The scene of this screen.
      protected java.lang.String stylesheet
      The additional stylesheet for this screen.

      The default window height.

      The default window width.

        public javafx.scene.Scene getScene()
        Gets the Scene of this Screen.
        Returns:
        The Scene for this Screen.

      • getStyleSheet

        public java.lang.String getStyleSheet()
        Gets the optional stylesheet of this Screen.
        Returns:
        The name of the extra stylesheet for this Screen, or null if it doesn't exist.

      • hasStylesheet

        private boolean hasStylesheet()
        Checks whether the screen has an additional stylesheet.
        Returns:
        True if there is a stylesheet, False otherwise.

      • setPrimaryStage

        public static void setPrimaryStage(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
        Sets the primary stage for all Screens.
        Parameters:
        stage - The stage to be used.

      • switchScreen

        public void switchScreen(Screen screen)
        Changes the Scene of the primary stage to the Scene of the Screen entered in the parameter.
        Parameters:
        screen - The screen containing the new Scene to be shown.

      • createPopup

        public void createPopup(Screen screen)
        Create a new popup window, that uses the Scene from the Screen entered as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        screen - The screen containing the new Scene to be shown.
